Those with a PhysXLoader.dll error Follow these steps.

1.) Uninstall any current nVidia PhysX via control panel.

2.) Runn CCLEANER (REGISTRY PART)

3.) Install latest nVidia version found here.
http://www.nvidia.com/object/physx-9.10.0224-driver.html

1. Download torrent

2. Mount the ISO file to a virtual CD drive (using either Daemon Tools Lite, PowerISO, etc.) or burn it to a DVD and insert it.

3. Setup should run by itself, otherwise go into My Computer and double click on your CD drive. Enter 'D5TA-WL3C-6QQJ-W77A-A6C5' when it asks for an installation key. Follow the prompts.

4. Go into My Computer, right click on the CD drive and click OPEN or EXPLORE. Open the CRACK folder. Copy TWFC.exe and use it to REPLACE the TWFC.exe found in the installation directory (C:\Program Files\Activision\Transformers - War for Cybertron\Binaries)

5. Play the game.

@desperadoamfrnrntry updating your windows installer, that is what causes 99 percent of all windows installer errors.  this seems to be the case with you since it seems the reloaded teams installer is causing errors for you, most people ignore windows updates and this is the result, of course your windows installer could be corrupted too i have had that happen alot myself.  hope this helps!

sorry for lackluster answer lol i meant reinstall your windows installer with newest network install (offline installer) version. i find this fixes most of probs with installer.  sorry for wrong meaning lol i had just woke up lol

there is one other possibility, Internet Explorer is linked directly to teh core of windows explorer, you have to have uncorrupted and updated IE to have windows function proper (i am not sure about vista and win7 on this) you could try reinstalling IE or updating it though you should have IE 8 already it might have been corrupted.  oh and make sure you defrag too, alot of my strange probs are caused by frag and registry trash. "anyone with video problems with this need to obviously do some updates and if that doesnt work then your computer isnt good enough...set the settings to low and go from there.  If you have an ati 3450 your not in luck you would need a 3850 or 3870 for ok performance, I use 2 4800's in crossfire but before that I upgraded from a 3870 and it still played games on high.  The questions to first ask yourself are..do I have a dual core..can I overclock it?  do I have at least 2 gigs of ddr2 800mhz memory?  if its good I can probly overclock it..do I have a good video card?  if not search on newegg and get a 5770 at the minimum...you can do dx11 and its just over a 100 bucks.  130 or so I think.  Its not that much faster than my 4800 and I have 2 of them..so I can compete both my cards with the new gfx cards..every game exept with max aa or max af but 1080p none the less.  4 gigs of memory is recommended.  try to aim for recommended game settings not minimum..because with minimum your going to have problems.
